38731307.review: An interesting puzzle game that doesn't overstay its welcome, but doesn't leave you wanting much more. Introducing new elements through each chapter keeps the "basic" gameplay of getting the critters to their home pad interesting through the entire game.

38706066.review:
A very great game, with good attention to the soundtrack and visuals.

The puzzles get more and more difficut as you progress, requiring more and more cognitive effort to solve them. It really gets your gears spinning, and it is really fun.

38702983.review:
It took me 4 hours to complete the game. Though short and sweet is nice, I'm not sure if the experience is worth 12€. The puzzles are decent but get repetitive pretty fast, and the way the story is told is awful. There is no way to conveniently revise the story so far, and it lacks coherency. The grapgics are nice, though.

Recommend the game if you can get it on sale.

38685694.review:
[h1] Introduction [/h1]
Personally I didn’t realize I even owned this game. I picked it out to play through a randomizer because of the sheer volume of games I own. Despite that, no matter what reasons it fell into my hands to play, I’m glad it did. This is a game that length wise is short and refreshing while offering up some difficult puzzles. All of which is tied to a story that while vague is beautiful.

[h1] Puzzles [/h1]
The puzzles are something I still don’t really know how to feel about. I’ve mulled over it for a while and I thinks while there’s a few negatives, the positives outweigh them. It’s a colour based puzzle, separated into acts with each act introducing a new mechanic. At first this seems like a good idea, the more mechanics they add, the more it seems to simplify the puzzle. Once you figure out the one hard little knot, the puzzle falls into place for you and you’re left feeling a little unsatisfied. Compared to other puzzles games, you don’t get a sense of accomplishment from completing the puzzles. The last puzzle I think is very charming and really finishes the game off well. 

[h1] Art [/h1]
This game’s art is charming. It’s reminiscent of a children’s book which is only aided by the story. Each act brings a new environment that matches the pacing and the puzzles quite well. As you journey up through the puzzles you start to understand how each location reflects within the story itself. I feel that the game may have been better off as a phone game but having the art in full resolution and colour works far too fantastically. It’s whimsical yet doesn’t undercut the sad and emotional tone of the game. 

[h1] Soundtrack [/h1]
I could honestly say that this music was one of the main reasons I cried. The story had already bore a hole in my heart and the music just further opened it up. It was well composed with nothing that would make it harder to think yet still conveyed a certain feeling. They’re shooting themselves in the foot by not making a soundtrack so great purchasable. Each song is perfectly tailored to the environment especially the act. The final act is what I would say a perfect culmination of a game. Everything peaks, the art, the sound, the music and the puzzle at the end is fun and charming.

[H1] What Makes it Special? 78/100 [/h1]
This is where I want to address the story throughout the game. It was lovely and it did in fact make me shed tears. I fell the only thing that might of made the writing slightly better is if it was voiced as to address some of the confusion over who is talking and to also add another layer of emotions. I do think that everything about this game ties around the story like a neat little package. Overall this game gives a nice but succinct finish. All the ideas are addressed and it doesn’t really give a feeling of longing at the end. You can tell it was made with love and that they knew it had to finish when it did.

38666343.review: Charming puzzle game, with rules that get more complex as you go through it.

38360286.review: Great puzzle design! Simple fresh mechanics, awesome optic and sound, trial and error will not help you solve the last levels.

38206571.review:
Сказочный мир, который действует по своим особым правилам. Гусеницы-мосты соглашаются пропускать только тех, кто такого же цвета, как они, а щупальца отпихивают похожих на них. Вам надо помочь маленьким существам найти путь к взлётным площадкам, чтобы они могли улететь в новую жизнь. 

Между уровнями рассказывается история или даже несколько разных историй. Всего лишь отрывки, но тем интереснее их изучать, пытаясь собрать в единую картину и понять, что происходит за кадром, о чём пытается рассказать игра.

38204437.review: 힐링되는 퍼즐 게임. 꼬물꼬물 귀엽다. 난이도는.. 퍼즐 게임이 늘 그렇듯이 갈수록 복잡해진다. 스토리는 스테이지마다 대화 방식이나 글귀로 나오는 것 같은데 영알못이라 자세히는 모르겠다.

38166121.review: Only for hardcore puzzle fans, it's a fancy display of intricate mathematic problem, it's easy to go crazy. It's perfect as a mobile game, not desktop.

38119936.review:
A cool concept that starts out fairly easy, then halfway through gets quite challenging. The game is on the short side, but it felt like the right length to me. The puzzles seem well-designed, but I wish it felt a bit more satisfying to complete them.

If you're looking for a few hours of challenging puzzes, get this game when it's on sale.

37887037.review:
J'ai terminé [B]She Remembered Caterpillars[/B], un jeu de puzzle où le but est d'amener des petites bestioles de couleurs différentes (jaune, bleu, rouge ; et ensuite, en mélangeant, vert, orange, violet, auxquelles s'ajoutent enfin blanc et noir) jusqu'à la "fin" des niveaux. Pour rendre tout ça intéressant, certaines portions de chemins ne sont accessibles qu'à certaines couleurs, certaines ne s'activent que si des bestioles restent appuyée sur des interrupteurs, ajouter à ça le fait de combiner et dé-combiner des bestioles deux à deux et vous obtenez un jeu dans lequel il faut parfois bien se triturer les méninges pour arriver à en voir le bout.
C'est extrêmement joli (dessiné et animé à la main), très mignon et bien pensé. Ça arrive souvent quand on joue à de chouettes jeux mais ça m'a semblé trop court malgré une durée de vie assez commune pour ce type de jeu (je dirais quatre heures, steam m'en indique cinq mais... j'ai fait tourner iddlemaster un petit peu...)
De quoi passer un peu de temps de façon tout à fait sympathique pour les amateurs de puzzle !

37683225.review: A beautifully illustrated, cute and challenging puzzle game.

37544930.review:
A quick and charming little puzzle game. It shouldn't take a huge amount of time to beat, depending on how good you are at puzzles. The game doesn't have a lot of replay value, but it's a great experience while it lasts. The music is nice, the story is the sort of mysterious, semi-metaphorical indie fair you see sometimes, but done well, and keeps you intrigued enough as you progress. The art and gameplay is where this game shines, the puzzles are fun, and are always adding some fresh new quirk or mechanic for you to figure out. The art is cute and captures a very fantastic, whimsical little world of its own.  

It's not too easy, puzzle-wise. Some levels had me stuck for a little while. The last level in particular required me to open paint and reverse engineer the puzzle. But nothing here is going to take you hours and hours to beat so long as you stick with it and experiment.  

Well worth it as a purchase!

37165484.review: Rompecabezas tiernos, pero igual de desafiante para niños y adultos

36871926.review: This is a very well-made puzzle game that manages to do quite a bit with fairly little. The basics of the puzzles are very simple, being based around color and whether each character has that color or lacks it. Even so, many of the puzzles can be quite difficult. The best part, though, is that even though the puzzles are color-based, they are also based on shape (which has been applied in a manner as intuitive as the color system), allowing the colorblind to also enjoy this game.

36862308.review:
Great puzzle game.
The art is beautiful, the atomesphere is subtle.

36822591.review: Excellent puzzle game, well balanced, increasing challenge that does not frustrate and beautiful atmospheric graphics and ambient music. Overall a nice brain teaser, highly recommended!

36769187.review:
Writing a review coz I nominated this game to my own steam award "A Precious small adventure" !

I recommend this game! The art style is lovely, charming; the puzzles are well thought and the color mechanic is very clever! Just when you get used to how simple it is at the beginning it soon becomes more complex and complex as you progress with the addition of new obstacles, mechanics and colors!

It is a small game of 8 Acts and a total of 40 puzzles; Took me 5 hours to beat in around one week, getting stuck in multiple puzzles for a while. But still I found this adventure to be worth it and enjoyable!

The soundtrack is very relaxing although some areas can get a bit dark.

Thumbs up!

34756770.review: I gem of a puzzle game. Challenging and Beautiful. Great sound design.

34746335.review: Beautiful and brilliant. One of the best puzzle games I've played. Further proof that a well designed game does not need tutorials.

34463708.review:
This is one of my favorite games now. 
Simple premise, intuitive puzzle game with a mature story (not GTA mature; Majora's Mask mature)
Beautiful art direction. 
Perfectly designed puzzles, not too easy, but easily accessible and never too difficult or obtuse to solve.

I played the demo, and liked it, but thought "great, but where could they possibly go from here?"
After buying the full game, I was quite pleasantly surprised to see how masterfully they built upon the game's core mechanics; to say the demo scratches the surface would be an overstatement. It's still definitely worth a play, though.

I really hope they release a level pack or a sequel or something. Even without a story.

33620635.review: Fun and challenging but not too difficult. Beautiful environment and great audio, definitely recommended for puzzle lovers.

33556208.review:
[h1]She Remembered Caterpillars Q Review found here -[/h1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QyjsYxAQ2a0

What jumpsuit entertainment as created here is a precious littler puzzle game that'll challenge you throughout. Progressing through 8 Acts, with each introducing a new mechanic, your task is to guide all the mushroom-headed people onto a pedestal. Quite the difficult task with what you're expected to work around in later levels.

The story is quite outlandish to begin with, but is revealed to you in text before each level commences. It tells a story of love, loss, death and acceptance. It's a exquisite way of telling a tale and how it fits in with the gameplay makes for quite the discovery! It's odd to find a puzzle game with a narrative but She Remembered Caterpillars handles it spectacularly.

Definitely a game to consider if you're a fan of puzzles, but those more casually-minded gamers might struggle with the concept. Brutally difficult in later levels, She Remembered Caterpillars is a gorgeous, formidable, wonderfully scored, excellently narrated journey I'd recommend people try out!

33546258.review:
Bought it (in sale) for the fascinating visuals, stayed for the rest.

It's very good in every aspect: visuals, music, narrative and gameplay. The game is not easy, but with some skill gained from previous levels, some deep cogitation, and a bit of trial-and-error and accustomation to the current level, one can reach the end. The story is interesting, even if, like the rest of the game, it's a bit mysterious and not easy to get at first.

In addition, I played the game on two computers on two different places, and thanks to the Steam Cloud support my saves were kept, and the game ran not super smoothly but okay enough on the "not powerful" machine I though would not be able to run this in the first place. Very appreciable.

33340125.review: Beautiful, haunting, touching, and surprisingly challenging (without being mind-numbingly impossible). This is a *great* puzzle game.

32969328.review:
Played the demo first hand during Casual Connect back in 2016 and immediately fell in love with the puzzle and the mysterious narrative behind the game.

If you like hard puzzle games, then this is the game for you because it get's quite hard progressively. Also what not to love of the little bouncy characters <3

32948298.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars is a challenging puzzle game that manages to incorporate a more complex story than you will usually find in a game of this type. Using only a few words or sentences for each section, it takes you on a journey of love and pain, joy and regret. Even if you skip the storyline entirely, the game is still beautiful. Bright colors standout against the muted blue, grey and aqua hued backgrounds. All of the creatures also have geometric shapes on them, helping to make colorblind mode actually functional. 

Your goal is to get each creature to an exit platform. Though the task is straighforward, the puzzles gradually become more complex, with new machanics being introduced at the start of any new chapter. Even without instructions, the gameplay is easy to understand and feels intuitive. I impatiently awaited the release of this game for a few months after demo-playing it at TwitchCon2016. The completed game and and lovely story did not disappoint.

32069420.review:
"Fait d’une narration curieuse et énigmatique, tout du moins lors des premiers niveaux, ce petit titre de réflexion de propose une quarantaine de niveaux assez complexe. Le principe du jeu se repose sur des chenilles de petits êtres colorés qui doivent toutes trouver un endroit ou se poser pour voir le niveau se terminer. Mais pour se faire, il faudra les diriger à travers une architecture originale faite d’autres êtres qui bloquent le passage des individus qui ne correspondent pas à sa couleur.

Il est par exemple possible de combiner deux êtres de couleurs différentes pour n’en faire qu’une, passer une porte de la même couleur puis les diviser de nouveaux de l’autre côté pour continuer à progresser. Les dix premiers niveaux sont assez simples, ceux d’après sont autrement plus difficiles. Les mécaniques se dévoilent au fur et a mesure, ne se ressemblent que très rarement et l’ambiance visuelle continue d’émerveiller tout au long de la progression.

Des puzzle-game malins, il en sort très souvent. De très beaux jeux de réflexion, c’est déjà plus rare. She Remembered Caterpillars fait les deux : il est intelligent et magnifique. Aucune raison de ne pas craquer pour lui, donc."

D'autres critiques sur Http://www.gamesidestory.com :P

31957771.review:
Необычная механика. Задачки не слишком сложные, но есть над чем подумать.
Очень симпатичный визуальный стиль и музыка.

Немного раздражает алгоритм построения маршрута, часто фишка идет не там где может пройти, а пытается пройти сквозь непроходимое для нее препятствие.

31940089.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars es un juego de puzzle muy divertido, con muy buen diseño de niveles, una curva de dificultad adecuada y un apartado artístico cautivador. Además de contar con una historia muy personal sobre el proceso de crecer, el amor y el temor a la muerte que le da un toque especial. Por sólo $11,99 merece mucho la pena.

Podeis ver el resto de mi análisis en el siguiente link:
https://takoko.net/2017/03/12/analisis-de-she-remembered-caterpillars-pc/

31767906.review:
한 편의 애니메이션을 보는 듯한 알록달록한 색깔 퍼즐 게임.

한 눈에 보기에도 알록달록한 색감이 눈에 띈다. 그리고 꼬마들과 애벌레 다리의 움직임 역시 꽤나 역동적이다. 어딘가 단편 애니메이션을 보는 기분이 든다. 정성이 느껴지는 그림체가 인상적인데, 아마 그래픽에 공을 꽤나 들인 듯 하다. 게임이 발매됐을 때부터 이 그래픽때문에 몇 번이고 시선이 끌렸던 게임이었다. 정작 게임을 실제로 플레이한 건 게임이 발매되고 4달이나 지난 지금이었다만.

쉬 리멤버드 캐터필라는 색깔을 컨셉으로 한 퍼즐 게임이다. 빨강, 노랑, 파랑의 꼬마들이 등장하고 같은 색깔의 애벌레 다리와 관문이 존재하는데, 애벌레 다리는 같은 색깔의 꼬마들만 통과가 가능하고 관문은 반대로 같은 색깔의 꼬마를 가로막는다. 나중엔 꼬마들끼리 몸을 합치기도 하는데, 두 색을 섞은 색상의 꼬마로 변하고 이에 따라 건널 수 있거나 가로막히게 되는 다리와 관문이 생기게 된다. 색깔의 기본적인 특성을 잘 활용한 퍼즐 게임인 것이다.

색깔이라는 단순하고 이해하기 쉬운 개념을 사용하기 때문에 비록 설명이 많지 않은 게임이어도 게임의 규칙을 이해하는 게 어렵진 않다. 색의 특성을 잘 이해하고 있다면 초중반은 무난히 넘어갈 수 있다. 다만 중후반 챕터부터는 레벨 디자인도 조금 난해해지고 그만큼 게임도 어려워진다. 챕터가 40개 정도로 많은 편은 아니지만 한 번 헤메기 시작하면 크게 헤메기 딱 좋은 퍼즐 게임이다. (참고로 꼬마의 색을 지우는 장치가 있고, 색을 지우게 되면 꼬마의 특성이 변하게 되는데 이 특성을 제대로 이해 못해 한 챕터에서 30분을 헤맸다.) 

챕터의 도입부마다 아버지와 딸의 사연인 듯한 이야기가 조금씩 서술된다. '그녀는 애벌레를 기억한다.'라는 은유적인 제목만큼이나 꽤나 서정적이고 슬픈 내용인 듯 하다만, 정작 본게임은 알록달록하고 화려한 색감의 애벌레와 꼬마들이 등장하고 분위기도 한껏 발랄한 데 챕터 도입부에서 눈물 쏙 빼는 이야기를 늘어놓고 있으니  어딘가 좀 이상하게 느껴지고 이야기에 공감이 좀 안 된다. 좀 극단적으로 말하자면 줄거리는 그냥 없었어도 크게 다른 점을 못 느꼈을 것 같다. 한글화가 안 된 탓도 있겠다만, 비주얼 노벨처럼 간단한 일러스트라도 몇 점 넣었으면 좀 괜찮지 않았을까 싶다.

알록달록하면서도 발랄한 느낌의 그래픽을 자랑하는 인디 게임이고, 난이도가 조금 어려운 만큼 깊게 고민해가며 풀어나가기에 딱 좋은 퍼즐 게임이다. 다만 시나리오가 전반적인 게임의 분위기와 다소 따로 논다는 점이 아쉽다. 

P.S! 그보다 어째 요즘들어 인디 씬에서 색을 활용한 퍼즐 게임들이 적잖이 나오는 것 같다. 단순한 우연인건지, 트렌드인건지...

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/221007070495

30813204.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars je logická hra. Úkoly jsou založené na (základních) barvách. Máte panáčky, mosty, brány různých barev. Modrý panáček přejde přes modrý most, ale nedostane se skrze modrou bránu. Postupně přibývají další komplikace, se kterými se musíte poprat. Rozhodně to není hra, kterou zvládnete za jedno odpoledne intenzivního hraní. Protože občas to prostě mozek už nebude zvládat a bude potřebovat pauzu. Občas jsem si zkoušela dokonce ty vzory kreslit do bloku, ale nijak mi to nepomohlo. Pokud máte rádi výzvu, tak to je rozhodně skvělá hra.

Rozsáhlejší recenze bude brzy na zing.cz.

30803867.review:
A beautiful little puzzle game, with an emotionally touching narrative accompanying it. The puzzles have appropriate difficulties, the visuals are amazing, the music and sound design is simple but atmospheric, charming and very effective. 

The only negatives I would say is that some people may consider it too short, some of the achievements have strange requirements and it isn't quite clear how the story fits with the puzzles.

I would reccomend it to any fan of puzzle games.

30697063.review: I was lucky enough to see this at PAX East and it intrigued me to demo it. After actualy purchasing the game and starting to run through it, I'm glad to say that it has exceeded the already high hopes I had for it when initially test playing it. I love the music and the simplicity of the mechanics combined with the complexity of the puzzles. Would highly recommend for anyone that enjoys puzzle games.

30661834.review: A beatiful and challenging puzzle game that was very satisfying to complete. It was a good length, the mechanics were easy to pick up naturally, and the difficulty progressed smoothly and kept me engaged throughout.

30519186.review:
This is a wonderfully animated, beautiful, atmospheric game with a complimentary ethereal soundtrack and some enjoyable puzzles.  I'm not a huge fan of puzzle games, but I really enjoyed this one.  I was pulled in by the stellar animation and not disappointed.  As the stages progressed in difficulty it got to a point in the early 30's where I was having much less fun,  but even then I appreciated the challenge and soldiered on through the last few levels to 40.  

Hats off to the game designers, they made a lot of wonderful choices when making this game.  I love the simplicity of controls.  The only UI in each stage is a simple menu button to let you focus on the puzzle.  It's simple, small, well placed, and blends into the background while still being easy to find if you want it.  While I'm not colorblind, I do think the game's design benefited from pairing colors and shapes together.

New mechanics are subtly introduced throughout the game without needing a tutorial or a constant reminder to push X button (The Last Guardian I'm looking at you).  The only time they really break this teaching by exploration is when you can merge and split gammies.  I completely agree with their decision as I don't think most people would have been able to figure that out.  I hate starting a new game and being forced to play a tutorial and memorizing an overcomplicated control scheme.  I also hate games that won't unlock their core mechanices until an hour or more into the game.  She Remembered Catapillars does a fantastic job at giving you the core mechanics right away, without handholding, and then subtily building on them throughout the game.  I wish more games took their approach and executed it well.  Again,  great game design.

The story is brief and encourages lots of interpretation.  In essance it's about a daughter dealing with the death of her estranged father.  Honestly, lots of it doesn't make much sense to me.  It's kept short enough to not detract from the game though.  The story is quite puzzling, and I'm not interested in trying to unravel its meaning.  It seems fitting a puzzle game would have a puzzling story.  I bet others will have some interesting theories on what it all means, since it seems like the game has plenty of figurative allusions and symbolisms.  It would be nice to have a menu option unlock after beating things so you can see just the story on its own.  Maybe then I could make more sense of it.  Somehow it feels like the puzzles are taking place in your father's brain, but maybe I'm just reading into things too much.

I feel the art direction of the backgrounds helped convey what the girl in the story was going through in a very abstract way.  [slight spoilers in the paragraph] In act 1 things start small while the story speaks of childhood.  Other sections seem diseased and decaying.  It then has a mechanical, almost surgical influance.  The hands in act 5 could symbolize trying to hold on to life, or having it slip away.  Act 7 feels empty and full of loss.  Life has gone.  Act 8 has the most gorgeous, abundant background of them all, showing rebirth, renewal, and perhaps acceptance of loss with the recovery that takes place afterwards.  

All in all it's a very well made game that strays from the tired zombie/crafting/FPS games flooding the market.  Check out the demo and see if it's your cup of tea.

30206973.review:
Me ha gustado mucho este juego. Una mecánica simple, una curva de aprendizaje muy bien pensada y llega a un nivel de dificultad justo en cuanto a desafío. A mi hija pequeña le encanta también, a lo que contribuye la estética del juego!
Si hubiera una expansión con más niveles me la compraba sin dudarlo!

29832612.review: The most beautiful game I played in a long time. Very hard puzzles!

29746678.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars манит к себе одними только скриншотами. Но что же там скрывается за чудесным визуальным оформлением? Может эти прекрасные, нарисованные от руки, кстати, картинки скрывают под собой бездушную монотонную механику? А может нам повезет и это окажется трагичная история поданная через увлекательную головоломку? Повезло.

She Remembered Caterpillars этап за этапом погружает нас во все более сложные загадки для маленьких человечков. Они носят форму разнообразных форм: квадраты, круги, конусы и так далее. Формы в свою очередь окрашены в соответствующие цвета. Цель всегда одна достичь специальных мест, чтобы человечки могли улететь. А вот достичь цели с каждым уровнем будет все сложнее. Придется знатно поломать голову. С каждой новой главой будут появляться новые преграды. С ними же новые герои, которых нам нужно довести до конца.



Одной из фишек She Remembered Caterpillar возможность объединять двух героев в одного. Это не просто довесок, это важная составляющая решения задач. Например, красный мост гусеница пропускает только квадратного красного героя, а нужно переправить ещё и круглого синего. Когда мы объединим их, то меняем геометрическую форму и цвет в соответствие с прошлыми, то есть становимся фиолетовым человечком колоколообразной формы. И так будет с каждым. Понятно, что к восьмой главе у вас волосы встанут дыбом, когда увидите то, что вам придется пройти.

Препятствия тоже не просто какие-то барьеры. Это живые существа: гусеницы, жуки, грибки. Одни рады нас пропустить, другие будут отгонять и всячески мешать нам. На самом деле, если бы не все эти милые декорации и общее настроение игры, выраженное не только рисовкой, но неспешной анимацией человечков и баррикад и музыкой, приятной и успокаивающей, то перед нами была бы обычная головоломка коих на самом деле уже тысячи.

Потому не стоит удивляться моему восхищению именно красотой игры, иметь преференции в этом жанре, можно только вот таким образом, упаковать проверенный временем механизм во что-то приятное глазу и ушам. И вот все условия выполнены и казалось бы слова все сказаны, но стоит упомянуть про сюжет…

https://youtu.be/x4UWbPMvXOU

Наличие сюжета в игре не так уж удивительно, если бы он был логически связан с тем, что происходит на экране. В She Remembered Caterpillars это что-то отдельное, живущее своей жизнью, как человечки и преграды. Мы последовательно от загадки к загадки узнаем печальную историю отца и его дочери. И вот уже к концу мы уже даже не задаем вопросов как могут быть связаны семейные дела и приключения красных, желтых, синих квадратов, сфер и конусов…

Для маленький инди головоломки тут есть все. Сильные загадки, прекрасная графика, интересный и трагический сюжет...Запомним ли мы гусениц? Думаю, да!

Кураторство - http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5763270/

29732015.review:
She remembered caterpillars is a really difficult puzzle game that uses a unique colour mechanic of getting little creatures to the white destinations while overcoming obstacles that include things like blockades for certain colours, bridge switch mechanics, etc. 

Story-wise the game is subtle and only gives excerpts of expositions as an intro to each level. It tells a decent story that has some good moments but it's easy to kinda overlook it when you're trying to go through puzzle after puzzle or if you're still recovering from the previous one.

The game is really difficult, it's not one of those puzzle games where the solution is immediately apparent and instead requires alot of experimentation. A new colour or mechanic is introduced every chapter (comes around every 4-6 levels) and the mixing of these mechanics makes it more complex in a way that's different from other games like portal. Because you're able to see the entire puzzle map from the start, segmenting the entire puzzle into parts to complete in an order is much harder than traditional puzzle games like Portal. You could very much end up getting one bug to one destination before realizing that you probably need him to get another bug somewhere else. The puzzles are all very logical and probably only have one solution per level and as a result, the game gives you a good challenge. 

Mix all that into presentation that's really unique (if you've heard of fungipunk aesthetic before playing this game, I'd love to find out where) and BGM that's subtle but fits nicely into the aesthetic of the vastly different visual maps, and it's good game for this niche genre. The parts we come to expect from this genre are done well and the parts we didn't are fascinating enough to give a fresh look into the game.

Here's a more detailed video review if you need more information: https://youtu.be/RBWstOU2lJs

29729505.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars has a simple premise: Bring the little hooded guys to the white mushroom platforms. But of course the path has obstacles - which are bridges and doors that have to have the right colour to get past them. You can even mix those colours to have more options - and obstacles ;)
I really love this idea, as they make genius puzzles that never get too complicated. But you have to think out of the box many times.
A perfectly designed little puzzle game with a very nice soundtrack (make sure to get the soundtrack if you love electronic music) and impressive hand-drawn levels that will make you feel smarter. I highly recommend this game to every puzzle game lover!

29688672.review: 太鸡个难了，玩到30+关根本没法往下走了，哭瞎。怕不是只有猛男才能过

29643063.review:
[h1]She Remembered Caterpillars takes a simple colour matching formula and expands upon it as you progress. As the plot thickens and becomes more complex, so do the puzzles, and you'll want to see the story through to the end--no matter how much you need to wrack your brains in order to complete the puzzle at hand. [/h1]

This is one of those games that you have to take a moment to digest after you've completed it. I'm not entirely sure what happened in the 40 chapters that transpired, though I'm sure there are some passionate forum posts somewhere arguing symbolism and the like, but what I am sure is that it was a sweet story that featured the simple love of a parent and child.

The game is divided into Acts and each Act has a number of chapters--40 in all. At the beginning of each chapter you're given a snippet of story and then you are tasked with leading some fungi creatures called "Gammies" to their proper place on a white flower that acts as a helipad for them to use to take off at the end of the stage.

In order to do that, you'll have to guide different coloured Gammies across/through obstacle. There are a few types with their own rules. None of the obstacles were actually named, so bear with my labelling. 

Beetle Bridges:  only Gammies of the same colour can pass.

Ferns: Gammies of the same colour cannot pass, but all others can. This applies to Gammies created by mixing colours; a purple Gammie, for instance, cannot pass through blue ferns.

Shell Bridges: these look luke sea shells. Any colour Gammie can cross these, but they require a switch (or switches) to be pressed so that the two halves of the bridge meet.

Colourizers: coloured devices that remove the their corresponding colour from Gammies. It can also add colour to a stripped white Gammie. White Gammies can pass through any fern, but cannot cross Beetle Bridges.

Switch Bridges: these look like remote controls. Any Gammie of any colour can pass them, but a fused of Gammie cannot. You can only pass in a single direction once; i.e. if you cross from the left, you need to have a Gammie cross from the right before the bridge resets and allows another Gammie to cross from the left. These are introduced later in the game and add a new logical element to puzzle solving: you need to pass them a certain number of times in order to create a clear path for other Gammies to cross.

Black Gammie: you’ll only see one of these at the very end of the game. They can pass over any bridge, but cannot go through ferns.

The game is lovingly hand-drawn and the animations are adorable. It’s a joy to watch the Gammies stand at attention, run to an indicated area, and crouch down to appear as innocuous fungi when your attention shifts to one of its brethren. It has a very family-friendly vibe with its bright colours and cutesy sound effects. Meanwhile, the music is adequately atmospheric; energetic and bubbly in the appropriate places and somber and slow in others.

.Pros.
[list] [*] The game looks great. It has a very distinctive art style.
[*] The music is peaceful and thematic.
[*] There is an interesting, if puzzling, story wound between puzzle solving segments.
[*] Puzzles get progressively more difficult and complex. Different elements are added at bit by bit and they all work together like a well-oiled machine.
[*] The puzzle mechanics themselves. There are quite a few of them and the variety keeps things fresh. [/list]
.Cons.
[list] [*] No replay value. Once you’ve played through all of the puzzles, I can’t imagine you’d want to play again.
[*] The difficulty towards the end of the game ramps up fairly quickly. I got stuck on a puzzle for nearly an hour before looking up a guide.
[*] No explanation of elements beyond the very beginning of the game. This isn’t a huge issue, but it would have been nice to know that I needed to change my way of thinking once the switch bridges had been added. 
[/list]

.Bottom Line.
This is a challenging puzzle game that’s definitely worth a playthrough if you’re interested in the genre. I recommend the game to story lovers, puzzle solvers, and those seeking an experience from a game that transcends the typical ‘get from point A to point B’ gig.

She Remembered Caterpillars may not be my favourite puzzle game, but it’s definitely in my top ten.

[code]If this review helped you, please give it a thumbs-up. For more reviews like this one follow the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/gamingwithNtK/curation]NeedtoKnow Gaming Curator[/url] page <3[/code]

29451076.review:
She Remembered Caterpillars est un puzzle game dans lequel il va falloir déplacer des créatures colorées jusqu'à des fleurs blanches pour valider le niveau. Naturellement, tout ne sera pas simple et de nombreuses contraintes liées aux couleurs arriveront rapidement en jeu.

Les ponts (qui sont des chenilles) ne pourront être traversés que par des créatures de leur couleur, des portiques bloqueront au contraire certaines couleurs, des fusions permettront de transporter certaines couleurs au delà de certains points, ou encore des boutons devront être appuyés simultanément pour créer un pont neutre permettant de réorganiser ses postions de bestioles. D'autres éléments arriveront, mais je n'en dis pas plus.

Les idées du jeu sont intelligentes avec une difficulté progressive ajoutant à chaque chapitre, sur un total de 7, de nouvelles mécaniques qui viendront s'ajouter à d'autres. Avec une ambiance dessinée très belle sur fond musical calme, le jeu est vraiment très sympa pour qui aime les puzzle game et aime passer une dizaine de minute à déplacer ses bestioles jusqu'à avoir l'éclair de lucidité !

J'ai fait une vidéo Youtube de présentation du jeu, disponible ici :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKhT4J9hH6Q

29451019.review: I really enjoy puzzles and obstacles games so when I was shown this game I was really interested in it. It was a great game with beautiful artwork. I liked all the characters as well as the underlying story. The only thing I am sad about is that I finished it in 6 hours. I hope that there will be more levels added or new acts. I look forward to the next game!

29427021.review:
The spirit of nature is both the giving and the taking of life, the color of growth and the greyness of decay. Just as natural as it is for things to be born and develop into full beings, it is natural for them to wither and die. There's nothing necessarily negative about this cycle, as touched on in [i]She Remembered Caterpillars[/i], as death creates space and circumstances for new and possibly stronger life to be created.

This cycle is communicated through the story of a father explaining this hard to grasp cycle of life and death to his daughter, and through the colorful and addictive gameplay. As small snippets of the story are told to us through bits of dialogue, our eyes are treated to a visual feast of vibrant organics and the small creatures who inhabit them named "Gammies".

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=848105089
[i]She Remembered Caterpillars[/i] first and foremost is an absolute treat for the senses. With a gorgeous and colorful handrawn style that looks like something out of a bestselling picturebook, and a powerful sound design that evokes the mysticism of a forest untouched by human exploration. from the whimsical and almost fantasy-like usage of organics to the usage of the small and cute spores who act as spirits of nature itself, [i]She Remembered Caterpillars[/i] gives a playful yet raw atmosphere of the more mysterious side of the natural world. Each screen is an entire work of art, and each work of art is the stage in which you navigate your small and color coded spore species.

Bridges can only be crossed by Gammies of the same color, and gates can only be passed by Gammies of the opposite color. And where things really get complicated is where you can combine Gammie's colors to make a new color that can pass through bridges any of its base colors but is still sectioned off by gates of another color. It's actually very hard to put into words and as I attempt to try I realize that this is a game that has to be "felt" to really get the full picture with, as you learn with every mistake how to utilize the combination of colors to properly navigate the vibrant fungal forest and sanctuary of spores.

Though the two games are wildly different in execution, I couldn't help but think of Pikmin while playing [i]She Remembered Caterpillars[/i]. Perhaps it was the adorable and iconic 'Gammie' creatures that play a part as guardian spirits of this fungal world, or the focus of color co-ordinated logical thinking, or the fact that it all takes place in a living and breathing natural world that acts and reacts as a part of the game itself. Whatever it was, I felt a special sense of nostalgic mysteriousness from a time where gaming seemed more unpredictable, fresh and new to my young mind.

Some games are made to be experiences that leave a lasting impression, and some games are made with the intention of purely being fun to play. [i]She Remembered Caterpillars[/i] is a rare occasion where both are achieved.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=844859903

29410391.review: Fun, thoughtful, artistic and satisfying puzzle game! And I love the name. Congrats to the team!

29384449.review:
First of all, it's a puzzle game. 
Reducing the game to its core, to its playing/game mechanics, the first few levels are nice to play, but nothing innovative at all. Step after step, the difficulty increases, then when you managed to master the first type of challenge, every few levels a new twist is added. (The principle of all the puzzles is some kind of variation of the riddle with the river, the fox, the cabbage, the goose, the farmer and the boat; but in later levels much more complicated and demanding.) This is done so perfectly, that, in fact, the game never gets boring, no, quite the opposite is true, you slowly become addicted: just one more, just one more... If you manage to solve a level, you feel deeply satisfied.
So, you have a kind of game, you've probably played many, many times before, but here something rare happened, it is executed just perfect.

What makes it escpecially beautiful is the fantastic art style and the surreal "story".

This game gives you even more than it might look like to you!

29343891.review: A lovely and challenging puzzle game with beautiful hand-drawn art.

29336506.review:
从谜叔微博看到过来的，尝试了一下，不错的游戏，既然没有中文测评就稍微写一点吧。
玩了几章，感觉是有点费脑子的解谜游戏。
游戏玩法非常简单，几乎不需要文字说明，就是不同颜色小人合体分离通过各种路障到达目标点，到目前为止甚至没有需要强制重开的死局出现。界面非常简洁清新，画风可爱。BGM十分空灵，有点洗脑。剧情全部通过每关开始前的文字和每章的文字进行介绍，留白不少，适合喜欢脑补的mong男。
如果像介绍说的40关的话感觉游戏流程稍微有些短，不知道后面会不会有能卡很久过不去的关卡出现。不过现在打折30块钱算是比较合理的价格，适合买回来消磨时间。推荐给喜欢解谜游戏的玩家。

29328385.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GLAKhedI7mY

I played this game for my channel and I've followed its progress for months. If anyone knows if you should get this game it's me. To get a good impression of the game, watch my gameplay review of Act 1 & 2 at the top.

I thought this game was going to be about 5 USD, I was very surprised that it's 12. That's around an hour of work for me or about 3-4 gallons of milk, or half a tank of gas even with Fuel Perks on.[strike][spoiler]or the yearly income of a channel our size.[/spoiler][/strike]

[i]To be fair, you can't discount all the talent and hard work that went into this absolute aesthetic masterpiece, I know personally that this game has taken them a year to make. I would definitely be willing to give 12 dollars for this if it was just me; but Steam caters to millions of people across the world, the average game sells 32,000 copies, I wouldn't say that this game's gonna make as much, seeing as how it's a puzzle game and might not appeal to the biggest news outlets or Youtubers, who drive sales of some games through the roof. So let's say this game sells only 10.000 copies, that would mean these two devs have to divide 120,000 in revenue, right now they're not even selling it for 12 dollars but 9.59 so that'd make it 95,900. This is without any percentages that Steam might take and other expenses. Steam takes about 30% at least, which is 28,770.

95,900 - 28,770 = 67,130. Each person takes 33,565. A person working full time for a year in my state makes $16,848.00 per year, two years is 33,696. That's nice and close, I like that number, it even has a 69 teehee.

What I'm saying is that at it's 9.59 price rate, selling 10.000 copies if it's in a year, would only be minimum wage, enough to drag these devs into having to make another game by next year or run out of money.

We all know minimum wage isn't very nice especially for a college graduate that's following their passion and laboring away for a year.[/i]

So now I'm done with this review I think that my first impression that it was going to be $5 was very low, there is a lot to this game, a story that drags you in, puzzles that hurt your brain [spoiler](get this game and by Act 4 you'll feel like ripping your hair out if that's what floats your boat)[/spoiler], amazing art, cute flying spore thingies, professional gameplay and interfaces. Get this game at full price if you know the struggle or you want to support an indie dev today and put a smile on their face.

[b]12 dollars is what you pay to see a movie that's a little more than an hour long, this game will bring you hours of an experience that may stay with you forever. Go buy it.

~ Approved.[/b]

29326419.review:
This is a puzzle game based on navigating little fungus people (gammies) to launch pads, so they can fly away. Getting there involves crossing caterpillar bridges and other obstacles. The gammies are marked by a colour and a shape, which dictates which obstacles they can cross. Using colours and shapes gives a backup for anyone who can't use one or the other, which is helpful for colourblindness or not being able to see fine detail very well.

Progress through the game is split into acts, which slowly take the player higher up a structure. Each act has a distinctive art theme, which reflects the feel of the story at that point. I loved the style of the art. It's hand drawn and whimsical, in a twisted fungal kind of way.

The story is told through text, which appears at the start of the levels and acts. It floats between memories of the girl and her father, and trying to save him using the gammies. It's a non-linear approach to storytelling that I see more often in short stories than games, and it fits very well here.

I enjoyed the game and would recommend it. The shape and colour concept of the puzzles was interesting, and it was very relaxed as there was no time limit. The art and story were great. Everything combined together to create something unique. It took me around five hours to complete the puzzles, but could take more or less time depending on skill.

29324994.review:
Fascinating puzzle game with an absolutely stunning athmosphere.

The puzzles are getting really challenging in the end which gives you that warm fuzzy reward feeling once you finally figured it out :-).

If you like puzzle games you will love this one!

29324961.review: Good puzzle game with a Pikminesque & Katamari-esque surreal and naturalistic aesthetics.

29322669.review:
Bei She Remembered Caterpillars handelt es sich um ein absolut spielenswertes, farben-basiertes Denk- und Knobelspiel. Ziel des Spiels ist es euren demenzkranken Vater vor dem Tod zu bewahren. Die verschiedenen Farben eurer Spielfiguren - rot, blau und lila - müsst ihr gekonnt einsetzen um die 40 Levels lösen zu können. Ziel eines jeden Levels ist es alle weißen Blumen mit den entsprechenden Spielfiguren zu besetzen. Rote und blaue Spielfiguren sind standardmäßig vorhanden, die lilafarbene Figur könnt ihr erstellen in dem ihr mit einem Rechtsklick auf der Maus rot und blau mischt. Aus zwei mach eins in diesem Fall. Ihr könnt die lilafarbene Figur durch einen weiteren Rechtsklick aber wieder "teilen" und dann wieder mit den beiden roten und blauen Figuren spielen. Brücken bestehen entweder aus blauen oder roten Tausendfüßlern bzw. Raupen. Mit der blauen Spielfigur könnt ihr z.B. nicht über rote Brücken gehen und anders herum. So muss man wirklich gut überlegen wie man ans Ziel kommt. Oft ist dies auch nur über die bereits angesprochene Verschmelzung beider Spielfiguren möglich. Außerdem sind manche Bereiche auch durch farbige Tore abgesperrt, welche auch nur mit manchen Figuren zu durchqueren sind.

Erwähnenswert ist auch die absolut hochauflösende Grafik von Daniel Leander Goffin, der auch Symmetrain erfunden hat, welches ihr vielleicht vom iPhone kennt. Diese gehört zu dem Besten was ich indiemäßig in der letzten Zeit gesehen habe. Nicht umsonst hat das Spiel eine IGF Nominierung für "Excellence in Visual Art" erhalten. Ein kleines bisschen erinnert die Grafik an ein wunderschönes handgezeichnetes Kinderbuch. Die stimmungsvolle Musik kommt auch von einem nicht ganz Unbekannten: Thomas Höhl, der unter anderem die Soundtracks für die bekannten Deponia-Spiele komponiert hat. Das ganze Spiel wirkt absolut professionell programmiert. Die Steuerung, welche komplett per Maus erfolgt, ist absolut präzise. Bugs habe ich in meiner bisherigen Spielerfahrung von ca. einer Stunde überhaupt keine feststellen können.

Die schon fast obligatorischen Steam-Features wie Achievements und Trading Cards sind natürlich auch vorhanden.

10/10 Punkte von meiner Seite für dieses optische Sahnestück, also eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

29322552.review: Nice game, I wait it for long~

29320536.review:
[h1] She Remembered Caterpillars - Review [/h1] 

[h1] Lógica a base de colores. [/h1] 

Al entrar al fantasmagórico mundo de She Remembered Caterpillars lo primero que notaremos es su particular y abstracto modo de contar una historia, la misma solo se desarrolla en breves fragmentos textuales, similar a lo que supuso Unravel en su momento. Sin embargo, en su interior se aguardan temas más profundos, dejando de lado su cautivadora historia. 
She Remembered Caterpillars fundamente su jugabilidad en los puzles, utiliza la lógica y el ingenio para avanzar en su orgánico mundo de fantasía, y para ello elabora unas mecánicas frescas, puras y completamente originales que se miden principalmente por el uso de colores. Entrando un poco más en detalle, la aventura nos da el control de una serie de micro personajes, estos seres toman la forma de diferentes colores como el azul, amarillo, y rojo, bajo el paso de estos curiosos seres debemos sortear diferentes caminos para llegar al punto de interés, y de ese modo viajar al siguiente capítulo. Sin embargo, los puzles van escalando su dificultad, y la transición eventualmente se torna más complicada conforme avanzamos en la aventura. 

Al principio solamente tenemos un par de colores, y por razones obvias, los caminos solamente se activan en base a ellos, como por ejemplo el rojo para puentes rojos, sin embargo, en cada nuevo nivel las mecánicas van variando, y además se añaden nuevos personajes que pueden ser combinados e implementandos con el escenario. De este modo, se puede utilizar el rojo y azul para crear el morado, y sortear caminos de sus colores iniciales (rojos y azules) o por otro lado, usar el rojo y amarillo, y así crear el naranja. Aunque, como mencione más arriba, cada color tiene sus restricciones y limitaciones, combinarlos no implica avanzar eternamente sobre cada puente o puerta, sino que debemos observar detenidamente el escenario, sus caminos y las opciones que se adecuan más a cada color, de este modo será más sencillo avanzar en su mundo. 

De todas formas, She Remembered Caterpillars pone al límite la lógica y el modo de percibir las cosas, cada nuevo nivel se destaca principalmente por ofrecer nuevas mecánicas y elementos como moléculas orgánicas que quitan o adhieren colores, o puentes que solamente tienen un sentido preestablecido. Estas tan solo son algunas de las tantas alocadas y llamativas ideas que encontraremos en She Remembered Caterpillars, pero lo genial de todo esto es la originalidad de la que desborda, la implementación de los colores, las múltiples combinaciones de estas piezas y su eventual conjunción para la resolución de sus puzles es simplemente soberbia, un trabajo de un gran nivel. 

[h1] Una forma diferente de contar historias. [/h1] 

Escalando la torre de las emociones. She Remembered Caterpillars evoca a lo más puro de los sentimientos. A lo largo de sus ocho actos plantea diferentes etapas de la vida, siendo el fracaso, la pérdida y madures los más recurrentes. Lo complicado que es convivir con las decisiones y lo efímera que es la vida en sí, la importancia de atesorar cada momento como si fuera el ultimo, y de transmitir los sentimientos hacia aquellos que son importantes. 
She Remembered Caterpillars es una propuesta arriesgada y cautivadora, trata temas muy personales de un modo muy ambiguo y abstracto, tan solo nos encontraremos con breves fragmentos de texto que se introducen de manera pausada como una descripción de aquello que esta por suceder, pero a causa de su naturaleza jugable y lo pragmatico de esta, es complicado determinar si los puzles y el encanto visual forman parte de un medio para interpretar su narración o simplemente mantiene un propósito preestablecido.

[h1] El cambio que buscamos en el mundo de los videojuegos. [/h1] 

El año recién ha comenzado, y definitivamente, She Remembered Caterpillars tiene todas las cualidades para formar parte del olimpo de los juegos de puzles. Es una grata sorpresa, en su simpleza se oculta un mundo lleno de misterio y conocimiento, repleto de posibilidades. Ante cada una de sus sublimes perspectivas isométricas logra magnificar su potencial y perdurar en lo más profundo de nuestros pensamientos, no solamente por lo rebuscado de sus puzles, ni siquiera por la belleza sin igual de la que tanto entona su mundo de fantasía, sino por aquella aura de misterio que se desprende, y los sentimientos que nos invaden al interiorizar en cada escenario. 
Para concluir, She Remembered Caterpillars, no es solamente un juego de puzles, es una experiencia mucho más profunda y personal, el anhelo de enseñanza no solamente lógica, sino también emocional. Es ese cambio que buscamos en la escena de los videojuegos.
